‚ÄúSometimes I‚Äôm down for like five months without work so right now I need to work. I need to pay my rent. I don‚Äôt have no money to pay my rent. I need to go to work,‚Äù he said, adding that he‚Äôll just stay overnight in the Garden State instead of trying to find a way back later.

Jay Santana, who works as a doorman [where], said he was forced to sleep in his breakroom overnight given his shift finished too close to the strike deadline.

‚ÄúI am going to Amtrak to try and figure out what train they have going to Trenton and then I can take it from there. If I can get a train to Trenton, I‚Äôll get a cab or Uber from there to get to my car and then go home,‚Äù he said of his long journey home.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm taking off the weekend. I‚Äôm going to come back Monday morning. It will be easier for me. I‚Äôm going to try driving closer to the PATH and then take it that way‚Ä¶. so that‚Äôs going to be like 60 miles driving or something like that.‚Äù

The strike came after the latest round of negotiations between NJ Transit and the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen union (BLET), which represents the engineers who drive the agency‚Äôs commuter trains, stalled ahead of a midnight deadline.

BLET is seeking its first pay increase since 2019 for 450 of its engineers, a source familiar with the negotiations earlier told The Post ‚Äî with the union adding it was aiming to raise the salaries to match those at other commuter railroads, including Amtrak and Long Island Railroad.

NJ¬†Transit, for its part,¬†has said it can‚Äôt afford the pay hike because 14 other unions that negotiate separate labor contracts with the agency would then demand higher wage rates as well.

The agency said the engineers currently make $135,000 on average and that management had offered a deal that would yield an average salary of $172,000. The union, however, disputed those figures, saying the current average salary is actually $113,000.

BLET National President Mark Wallace said the engineers are committed to staying on strike until they get a fair deal.

‚ÄúFor six years our engineers, they have not had a pay raise. They make $10 less an hour than Long Island Railroad. They make $10 less an hour than Amtrak, Path, ¬†Metro North. They‚Äôre the lowest paid commuter engineers today in the United States,‚Äù he said.

With Post wires
item.author: Georgett Roberts, Khristina Narizhnaya, Emily Crane

item.title: Cuomo‰øùÈáäÁ∫ΩÁ∫¶Â∏ÇÈ´òÁ∫ß‰∏≠ÂøÉËÆøÈóÆÔºåÊäóËÆÆËÄÖÂ∏åÊúõ‰∏éÂâçÊîøÂ∫úÂ∞±ÂÖªËÄÅÈô¢Ê≠ª‰∫°‰∏ëÈóªËøõË°åÂØπÊäó | Cuomo bails on NYC senior center visit where protesters hoped to confront ex-gov over nursing home death scandal
item.description:
Mayoral hopeful Andrew Cuomo bailed on a planned visit Friday to a Queens senior center as dozens of raging protesters were expected to confront the ex-gov over his botched handling of the nursing homes during the pandemic.

About 25 protesters marched in front of Peter Cardella Senior Citizens Center in Ridgewood for over an hour as they eagerly waited to face Cuomo over his administration‚Äôs¬†controversial directive¬†to send infected COVID-19 patients into nursing homes ‚Äî which resulted in thousands of deaths.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm still trying to process and come to terms with how to prevent that [a pandemic] from happening again, but I‚Äôm pretty dismayed that Andrew Cuomo has the gall to run for mayor,‚Äù said Dr. Damien Archbold, an anesthesiologist at Elmhurst Hospital, told The Post.

‚ÄúI have this moral indignation that Cuomo‚Äôs running for mayor of New York City after he sold out the city.‚Äù

Cuomo was initially scheduled to hit the senior citizens center on the campaign trail ‚Äî prompting the group to rush to the building.

‚ÄúI like what you guys are doing, where can I get a sign?‚Äù one woman asked before joining their ranks.

Across the street, a neighbor yelled: ‚ÄúHold up your signs so I can take a picture. F‚Äìk that guy!‚Äù

The campaign claims the former governor, who resigned amid a series of scandals, had no plans to show up with the event being cancelled days ago.

‚ÄúWe were never confirmed for that senior center and it was our understanding they knew that as of this past Wednesday, but we look forward to visiting it as Andrew Cuomo continues to meet voters and discuss his vision for a safer and more affordable New York City,‚Äù said campaign spokesman Rich Azzopardi.

However, two workers in the senior center told The Post the campaign pulled the plug Friday morning.

The center is not a nursing home ‚Äî seniors visit the building to socialize, but do not live or sleep in the building.

Protesters, however, viewed Cuomo‚Äôs visit to an elderly facility as disingenuous after his fatal COVID-19 policies allowed the virus to tear through nursing homes at the height of the pandemic ‚Äî a responsibility he has continuously declined to acknowledge.

Daniel Arbeeny, who attended the rally with We Care Memorial Wall, a group dedicated to ‚Äúexposing Cuomo‚Äôs nursing home death cover-up,‚Äù said he was protesting in memory of the loved ones he lost during the pandemic.

The Arbeeny family lost four members in a single week, including his beloved father.

In a tweet, another activist group, VoicesForSeniors, simply said: ‚ÄúCoward can‚Äôt face us!‚Äù

‚ÄúWe want the truth. We want the people to know what happened, and we want answers,‚Äù Arbeeny said.

Republican mayoral candidate Curtis Sliwa‚Äôs team also showed up upon hearing of the demonstration, with his campaign advisor Sharon Liao telling The Post: ‚ÄúCuomo made a very wrong decision during the pandemic to send the patients of COVID-19 to the nursing homes. 15,000 people died because of his mistake, and we just don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs worthy of being the mayor.‚Äù

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care about the sexual harassment, this is real life. This is a more serious matter, we care about life,‚Äù she continued.

When asked what she would say to Cuomo if he were here today, Liao said: ‚ÄúPlease stop ruining our city. If he ruined New York State when he was the governor, imagine in New York City, which is much more complicated.‚Äù

Cuomo has skirted blame for the roughly 15,000 people who died in nursing homes across the state during the pandemic, which many have traced back to the then-Governor‚Äôs decision to shuttle infected patients into the facilities.

In March, Cuomo offered a half-baked apology when asked if he owned family members of those who died an apology, saying instead: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry for what they had to go through.‚Äù

Despite criticism of his nursing home decisions, Cuomo is currently leading the polls for the Democratic nomination for mayor in next month‚Äôs primary vote over second place rival Zohran Mamdani.
item.author: Melanie Marich, Craig McCarthy, Katherine Donlevy

item.title: ÂæãÂ∏àÊèêÂá∫Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù CombsÁöÑË∫ÅÈÉÅÁóáËØäÊñ≠ÂèØËÉΩ‰∏é2018Âπ¥Ê∂âÂ´åÂº∫Â•∏ÊúâÂÖ≥ | Attorney brings up Sean ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äô Combs‚Äô bipolar diagnosis as possible link to alleged 2018 rape
item.description:
Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‚Äô attorney insinuated Friday that the mogul‚Äôs previously undisclosed bipolar disorder could be linked to his alleged 2018 sexual assault of Cassie Ventura.

The diagnosis came up when defense attorney Anna Estevao asked Ventura in Manhattan federal court about what she had told investigators regarding Combs‚Äô mood the night of the alleged rape.

Ventura testified that she said Combs was acting ‚Äústrangely‚Äù earlier that night at dinner ‚Äî ‚Äúnice, but strangely‚Äù ‚Äî and that he ‚Äúwasn‚Äôt in his right mind‚Äù because when she pleaded with him to stop, he didn‚Äôt.

Combs‚Äô attorney then asked Ventura to confirm whether she told prosecutors that ‚Äúhis behavior [that night] could be attributed to his bipolar disorder.‚Äù

Ventura muttered, ‚ÄúI guess so.‚Äù

The exchange was the first time the defense mentioned a potential bipolar diagnosis at Combs‚Äô sex trafficking and racketeering trial.

But Combs‚Äô volatile moods hav came up frequently during the proceedings, especially as his ex-girlfriend Ventura took the stand.

She testified the mogul‚Äôs moods affected every aspect of her life during their tumultuous decade together.

‚ÄúThey affected my whole life, my career, how I felt about myself, my self worth,‚Äù the R&B singer said.

Ventura, while being questioned by prosecutors after a marathon two-day grilling by defense, also recounted how Combs‚Äô desire to hold depraved ‚Äúfreak-off‚Äù sex parties consumed their lives.

‚ÄúIf he was in the mood to have a freak off, my work would take the back seat,‚Äù she said.

Her testimony wrapped Friday, following four grueling days on the stand.

Combs, 55, has pleaded not guilty to charges including sex-trafficking and racketeering.

He could face life in prison if convicted at trial, which is expected to last through June.
item.author: Kyle Schnitzer, Jack Morphet, Priscilla DeGregory, Matt Troutman

item.title: ÂΩìË¢´ÈóÆÂèäÂ†ïËêΩÁöÑÊÄßË°å‰∏∫„ÄÅ‚ÄúÊÄ™ËÉé‚ÄùÊúüÈó¥ÁöÑÊÆ¥ÊâìÊó∂Ôºå Cassie VenturaÊ≥™ÊµÅÊª°Èù¢Ôºö ‚ÄúËøôËÆ©ÊàëÊÑüÂà∞‰∏ÄÊñá‰∏çÂÄº‚Äù | Cassie Ventura bursts into tears when asked about depraved sex acts, beatings during ‚Äòfreak-offs‚Äô: ‚ÄòIt made me feel worthless‚Äô
item.description:
Cassie Ventura broke into tears on the witness stand Friday when asked about the depraved sex acts Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs allegedly forced her into ‚Äî and beatings he inflicted during his twisted ‚Äúfreak-offs.‚Äù

Prosecutor Emily Johnson asked Ventura about the defense‚Äôs suggestion that she had ‚Äúcherished‚Äù the highly-choreographed sex sessions where she was allegedly forced to sleep with male escorts as Combs watched.

‚ÄúHow would you describe an escort urinating in your mouth while you were on the floor?‚Äù Johnson asked ‚Äî drawing a quick objection from the defense, which was sustained, and prompting Ventura to begin crying.

Ventura continued answering questions through tears as Johnson asked her how many times Combs pressured her to participate in a ‚Äúfreak-off‚Äù while she had a urinary tract infection.

‚ÄúFrequently,‚Äù she responded.

When asked how she felt getting beaten by Combs during the sex marathons, Ventura responded: ‚ÄúWorthless. Um, just like dirt. Like I didn‚Äôt matter to him. Like I was nothing. Absolutely nothing.‚Äù
item.author: Jack Morphet, Priscilla DeGregory

item.title: ËøôÊòØÂú®Cassie VenturaÁöÑÁàÜÁÇ∏ÊÄßËØÅËØç‰πãÂêéDiddyÂÆ°Âà§ËØÅ‰∫∫ÂêçÂçï‰∏äÁöÑ‰∫∫ | Here‚Äôs who‚Äôs on the Diddy trial witness list after Cassie Ventura‚Äôs explosive testimony
item.description:
Cassie Ventura‚Äôs harrowing turn as the star witness in Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‚Äô trial is expected to end Friday after four electrifying days ‚Äî and prosecutors plan to bring other alleged victims to the stand.

Dawn Richard, a singer in the Combs-founded group Danity Kane, is slated to be one of the next witnesses.

She has accused the Bad Boy Records mogul of once breaking into her dressing room and¬†groping her breasts and butt ‚Äî as well as claimed to have witnessed Combs slamming Ventura against a wall.

The Danity Kane alum will be joined by two other alleged victims.

An anonymous woman known as ‚ÄúJane‚Äù ‚Äî who started dating Combs in 2020 ‚Äî is slated to tell the jury about how she was expected to have sex with escorts without a condom against her wishes, prosecutors said.

She will describe a horrific night when Combs ‚Äúviciously‚Äù attacked her, ‚Äúpunched her in the face while she was curled up in a ball on the ground,‚Äù and slapped her ‚Äúso hard she fell over,‚Äù the prosecutor said.

Another victim, ‚ÄúMia‚Äù ‚Äî who worked for Combs as his personal assistant for several years ‚Äî will testify about being forced to perform oral sex on Combs and also being raped by him, according to prosecutors.

Other witnesses slated to testify are male sex workers who participated in Combs‚Äô ‚Äúfreak-off‚Äù sex romps and former employees of his companies.

Aubrey O‚ÄôDay, another Danity Kane member, has also reportedly been subpoenaed to testify in the bombshell case.
item.author: Matt Troutman

item.title: Cassie VenturaÂØπSean ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äò CombsÁöÑÂº∫Â•∏ÊåáÊéßËøõË°åÁÉßÁÉ§ÔºåËæ©ÊñπËØïÂõæÂú®Â•πÁöÑÈáçÁ£ÖÁÇ∏ÂºπËØÅËØç‰∏≠Êà≥Ê¥û | Cassie Ventura grilled over Sean ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äô Combs rape claim as defense tries to poke holes in her bombshell testimony
item.description:
Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‚Äô defense hammered Cassie Ventura over the timing of when the mogul allegedly raped her in an attempt to poke holes in the bombshell accusation.

Ventura, 38, had told prosecutors that Combs raped her in August 2018.

But the R&B singer previously alleged in a lawsuit that Combs did so in September 2018.

Combs‚Äô defense attorney Anna Estevoa brought up texts from August 2018 between the Bad Boy Records producer and Ventura to try to undercut the accusation.

‚ÄúHit me when you can ‚Äòheart emoji,'‚Äù Ventura texted Combs.

During the same conversation, Combs texted Ventura: ‚ÄúI know I look bad to you. I could tell I didn‚Äôt turn you on yesterday. I fell off.‚Äù

A month later, Combs and Ventura texted amid their final breakup ‚Äî and Estevao pointed out that Cassie didn‚Äôt mention the alleged sexual assault.

‚ÄúYou don‚Äôt say anything to the effect of the last time we saw each other you raped me?‚Äù Estevao asked Ventura.

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Ventura responded.

‚ÄúIn fact you‚Äôre saying you want to keep the peace?‚Äù Estevao asked.

‚ÄúRight,‚Äù Ventura said.
item.author: Matt Troutman, Jack Morphet, Kyle Schnitzer

item.title: Â∞ºÂÖãÊñØÁöÑÁÅ∞ÂßëÂ®òË∑ëÊ≠•ÁîöËá≥ÊúâÂØπÊâãÁØÆÁΩëÁêÉËø∑Á©øÁùÄËìùËâ≤ÂíåÊ©ôËâ≤Ôºö ‚ÄúÁ∫ΩÁ∫¶Êàñ‰ªÄ‰πàÈÉΩÊ≤°Êúâ‚Äù | The Knicks‚Äô Cinderella run even has rival Nets fans donning blue and orange: ‚ÄòNew York or nothing‚Äô
item.description:
The Knicks fever is hitting the Big Apple with a double ‚Äúbang‚Äù strong enough to shake even the strongest Nets fans‚Äô loyalty.

Bars outside the Barclays Center ‚Äî staunch Nets territory ‚Äî have been buzzing with anticipation and excitement as the Knicks give the Celtics a run for their money.

For many, the reason is simple.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs New York or nothing,‚Äù Perry, a bartender at That Bar on Bergen Street who is suspending his Nets fandom in support of the Knicks this week, told The Post.

Friday‚Äôs Game 6 against Boston could be the determining factor for the Knicks, who will have their chance to advance to the Eastern Conference Finals for the first time since 2000 ‚Äî and keep alive the city‚Äôs dreams of a Cinderella-run straight to an NBA championship.

The New York team is up 3-2 in the best-of-seven series against the defending champions, which included two heartstopping back-to-back wins on the Celtics‚Äô home turf.

But the possibility that the Knicks could beat the Celtics in a playoff series ‚Äî a feat they haven‚Äôt accomplished since 2013 ‚Äî is enough to turn any New Yorker into a Knicks fan this spring ‚Äî even die-hard Nets fans.

‚ÄúNew York all day. During the season, it‚Äôs Brooklyn only. I‚Äôm making an exception for tomorrow because the Nets aren‚Äôt in it and I am rooting for New York,‚Äù said Beaz, 33, a Brooklynite enjoying a drink at BK9 Bar Thursday night.

Chari, a Knicks fan drinking with friends nearby, agreed, saying continuing a rivalry amid such a historic time in Gotham would be the ultimate betrayal.

‚ÄúI feel like it‚Äôs easy to hop on the hate bandwagon. There‚Äôs a really good energy in the air right now. Like, New York should just be interested in New York winning, should support the cause,‚Äù Charli, of Brooklyn.

‚ÄúLet the Knicks win, let us win. Nets are not an option. You guys are not even a contender. Let New York win, for the energy, for the culture.‚Äù¬†

A Knicks win would be momentous for the city, said Cynthia Brown, who was watching the Nuggets game at McMahon‚Äôs Public House.

‚ÄúI want the Knicks to win cause I feel like we haven‚Äôt seen so many people happy right now because New York is so stressful, everybody is going through a lot.

‚ÄúNew York needs this. If they win, they‚Äôre gonna put a smile on everyone‚Äôs faces‚Ä¶ I feel like the Knicks give people so much energy,‚Äù the nurse in her 30s continued.

‚ÄúI want to experience what my mother saw in 1999 and 2000. I wanna see that ocean of blue on Atlantic Avenue.‚Äù¬†

Follow The Post‚Äôs coverage of the Knicks in the 2025 NBA Playoffs

  • Knicks throttled by Celtics as they blow chance to finish off champs
  • Knicks‚Äô Game 5 report card: Nightmare for starters ‚Äî with one exception
  • Knicks fans console themselves in wild MSG scene that includes new chant, shots of honey
  • Knicks stars get their ‚Äòwings‚Äô clipped in nightmarish Game 5 showings

Sports+ subscribers: Sign up for Inside the Knicks to get daily newsletter coverage and join Expert Take for insider texts about the series.

Edward Lawrie, 29, emphasized that it didn‚Äôt matter whether the Knicks or the Nets made it to the playoffs ‚Äî New Yorkers should be supporting either one.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a New York thing. Tomorrow it‚Äôs just about New York. If the Nets were playing, I would have gotten a Batman costume and put the Nets across my chest,‚Äù Lawrie said.

‚ÄúThat‚Äôs how much I would have been rooting for the Nets if the Nets were playing tomorrow,‚Äù Lawrie, a chef from Harlem, said, calling Friday‚Äôs game ‚Äúsacred.‚Äù

Still, some diehard Nets supporters haven‚Äôt been able to completely shake their loyalty ‚Äî including Chris, who said he was ‚Äúvery conflicted‚Äù on who he should root for this playoffs.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not going to be sad if Boston wins. That might sound very, you know, not good for Knicks fans. But I mean, I wouldn‚Äôt be sad if they win,‚Äù he said.

At the end of the day, however, he conceded he was excited that a New York team was in the running: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm a Mets fan, but if the Yankees make the playoffs, great, it‚Äôs good for the city of New York. It‚Äôs fun.‚Äù

But not all Nets fans are willing to openly admit their traitorous ways.

Colette Reilly, a bartender at McMahon‚Äôs near the Barclays Center, says many Nets fanatics come in disguise to cheer on the rival New York team.

‚ÄúI think the Nets fans secretly still want New York to win because, you know, it‚Äôs New York, we all want to win. And it‚Äôs Boston, so why would we not want to beat them?‚Äù¬†she said.

‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt come with, like Nets gear for a Knicks game. No‚Ä¶ When the Knicks play it‚Äôs all blue and orange everywhere. Everyone was all dressed up coming in and all the girls had their blue on and it was a bit of a party going on, so it was fun.‚Äù¬†

Other basketball fans out in Brooklyn on Thursday adamantly refused to convert to the Knicks fandom out of pure vitriol for the team.

‚ÄúI have friends that are Knicks fans that are annoying, and I do not want them to celebrate, throughout the years, a new championship. I do not want them to win. ‚ÄòCause if the Knicks win this series, I believe they will make it to the finals,‚Äù said Kahliel of Brooklyn, a Bulls fan and self-identified ‚Äúnumber one Knick hater.‚Äù

For Cam, 40, he was concerned that the first Knicks playoff win in over a decade would pose a public safety issue.

‚ÄúIf the Knicks win, New York would be Gotham City and we don‚Äôt need that. So the Knicks will lose the series if they lose tomorrow,‚Äù Cam said, adding that he‚Äôs neither a Nets or Knicks fan.

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs a lot of hope and a lot of praise for getting to the second round. They‚Äôre having a great year, but eventually all Cinderellas come to their end, and when it does end, I just hope that they accept that they had a good year and press reset because it‚Äôs not their time.‚Äù¬†
item.author: Marie Pohl, Katherine Donlevy

item.title: Êñ∞Ê≥ΩË•øÂ∑ûÂÖ¨ÂÖ±‰∫§ÈÄöÁΩ¢Â∑•ÊúüÈó¥Êõø‰ª£ÊúçÂä°Ë∑ØÁ∫øÁöÑÊ≥®ÊÑè‰∫ãÈ°π | What to know about alternative service routes during NJ Transit strike
item.description:
New Jersey Transit trains screeched to a halt Friday as locomotive engineers struck ‚Äî leaving commuters scrambling to figure out alternate means of transportation from the Garden State to the Big Apple and beyond.

Contingency plans, which kick in Monday, will include additional bus routes and park-and-ride locations but will only be able to accommodate 20% of rail customers, focusing mainly on its largest customer base, 70,000 New York-bound customers, according to NJ Transit.

About 400 rail engineers with the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen union seeking wage increases walked off the job after contract negotiations failed, marking the Garden State‚Äôs first major strike in 40 years affecting some 350,000 commuters.

Here‚Äôs what to know about alternative service routes during the strike:

What are the alternative bus routes?

Starting Monday, NJ Transit is ramping up peak service on the following New York bus routes that are in close proximity to rail stations:

  • Northeast Corridor:¬†108,¬†112,¬†115¬†and¬†129¬†bus routes
  • North Jersey Coast Line:¬†116¬†and¬†133/135¬†bus routes
  • Raritan Valley Line:¬†112¬†and¬†113¬†bus routes
  • Morris & Essex Lines:¬†107 bus routes
  • Montclair-Boonton Lines:¬†193¬†and¬†324¬†bus routes
  • Main/Bergen County Lines:¬†145,¬†163,¬†164¬†and¬†190¬†bus routes
  • Pascack Valley Line:¬†163,¬†164¬†and¬†165¬†bus routes

NJ Transit‚Äôs Park & Ride bus service will be available starting Monday on a first-come, first-served basis during peak hours from four additional locations: Secaucus Junction, PNC Bank Arts Center, Hamilton Rail Station and Woodbridge Center.

More information is available on NJ Transit‚Äôs rail strike page.

Will PATH service be impacted?

The PATH will run on a normal service schedule but will likely see crowding during peak hours, Port Authority, its operator, advised.

‚ÄúPATH will monitor stations and add service as necessary to address any unsafe conditions,‚Äù Port Authority said on its website.

It advised riders to avoid the system during rush hour.

Other alternatives include Amtrak, light rail and ferry service.

Will Metro-North be impacted?

Metro-North‚Äôs west of Hudson service on the Port Jervis and Pascack Valley lines is also suspended, according to the MTA.

The railroad is providing alternate routes, including cross-Hudson routes to connect with Hudson and Harlem Line trains, where west-of-Hudson tickets will be cross-honored.

Parking permits at select east-of-Hudson stations will also be accepted.

A full list of alternate MTA service options, including buses and ferries, can be found on its website.

Will these alternatives operate over the weekend?

While PATH and NJ Transit bus service will still be available, the contingency plans from NJ Transit won‚Äôt be implemented until Monday.

The strike could thwart travel plans Friday for fans headed to the first game of the Subway Series at Yankee Stadium, Game 5 of the Knicks-Celtics Eastern Conference semifinals at Madison Square Garden and the Shakira-Pitbull concert at MetLife Stadium.

Gov. Phil Murphy, NJ Transit CEO Kris Kolluri and rail engineers will head back to the negotiation table on Sunday in the hopes of ending the strike in time for the workweek.
item.author: Deirdre Bardolf

item.title: Dave PortnoyÂàöÂàöÁªô‰∫ÜËøô‰∏™ÁÉ≠ÈóπÁöÑÊñ∞Á∫ΩÁ∫¶Êä´Ëê®Â∫ó9.2ÁöÑËØÑÂàÜÔºåÁé∞Âú®ÂÆÉÂçñÂæóÂæàÁñØÁãÇ‚ÄîËøôÂ∞±ÊòØÁúüÊ≠£ÁöÑÁ∫ΩÁ∫¶‰∫∫ÁöÑÊÉ≥Ê≥ï | Dave Portnoy just gave this buzzy new NYC pizza spot a 9.2 rating, and now it‚Äôs selling out like crazy ‚Äî here‚Äôs what real New Yorkers think
item.description:
Dave Portnoy just handed out one of his highest pizza ratings ever to a newly opened pizza spot in Little Italy ‚Äì which is now causing impatient lines and sold-out pies.

The Barstool Sports founder is known for his viral ‚Äî not to mention controversial ‚Äî one-bite pizza reviews. And he recently gave Ceres ‚Äî a three-month-old-or-so pizzeria at 164 Mott St. run by two former Eleven Madison Park chefs, Jake Serebnick and Julian Geldmacher ‚Äî a whopping 9.2 out of 10 score.

Portnoy showered it with praise, calling it ‚Äúspectacular‚Äù and ‚Äúmust-have, top-of-the-list Manhattan pizza ‚Ä¶ as good as it gets.‚Äù

Does he have a new favorite NYC slice? That glory at least puts it thin-slice close to a trio of his fight-inducing, top-tier NYC faves Portnoy revealed to The Post last fall: ‚ÄúJohn‚Äôs of Bleecker, Lucali and Luigi‚Äôs. Those would be three that are all up there.‚Äù

Now, only a few days after Portnoy‚Äôs review dropped, lines at Ceres are out the door, $6 slices are selling out, and whole $40 pies are being sold on a time-slot basis only.

As The Post‚Äôs food columnist Steve Cuozzo previously noted in his review of Ceres, the duo‚Äôs ‚Äúkitchen skills show in their painstaking pizza preparation,‚Äù which includes a crust made with wild yeast and toppings applied with what Cuozzo called ‚Äúa scientist‚Äôs precision.‚Äù

To keep up with the demand, Serebnick and Geldmacher ‚Äî the pizzeria‚Äôs only two workers ‚Äî are enforcing a system where hungry pizza fans can start lining up at noon sharp when the shop opens to snag a time slot, then return later to claim their piping-hot pie.

The young owners might be basking in their shop‚Äôs rising popularity, but those who have been fans of Ceres since they opened are grumpy about Portnoy drawing massive crowds.

One X (formerly Twitter) user wrote, ‚ÄúDude. Wtf @barstoolsports @stoolpresidente ‚Äì you ruined my favorite pizza spot. The line is fully down the block now,‚Äù along with a picture of a massive line wrapping around Mott St.

The Post has reached out to Portnoy for further comment.

Pizza pandemonium

On Thursday, locals like Jacob Shemia, Stanley Chera and Ness Ades waited hours to get a taste of what‚Äôs quickly becoming Manhattan‚Äôs most talked-about slice.

‚ÄúI saw Dave‚Äôs video and how he gave it a 9.2. I live down here and thought, ‚ÄòWow, I have to come,‚Äô‚Äù Ades told The Post.

‚ÄúI came for the first time yesterday, it sold out at 4 p.m., and they told me to come back today. I did at 11 a.m., they put my name down, and I was just able to get it at 5:30 p.m.‚Äù

Shemia, who arrived at noon and was fortunate enough to get a 5 p.m. slot, called Portnoy the ultimate ‚Äúguy of pizza‚Äù and said, ‚ÄúWhen you hear Dave saying something‚Äôs good, you have to go try it.‚Äù

Chera, a self-proclaimed pizza aficionado from Brooklyn, wasn‚Äôt going to let the chance slip by either. ‚ÄúI thought, ‚ÄòYou know what? I need this slice of pizza.‚Äù

Eager pizza fans who didn‚Äôt know of the time-slot rule were turned away by 5 p.m. as a pizza box scrawled with the words ‚ÄúSold Out‚Äù in black ink was taped to the storefront by the owners.¬†

The Ceres Instagram account (@ceres.nyc) recently noted that the pizzeria can only cook six pies at a time and maxes out at 140 per day.¬†

‚ÄúWe don‚Äôt do online ordering,‚Äù the Story post added, urging fans to get there early or risk going home empty-handed ‚Äî which is what happened to many saddened customers, like Alexa Albert.

‚ÄúI thought I was going to get here before the evening rush, and I was so disappointed,‚Äù Albert from Seattle told The Post.

Is the $40 pizza worth it?

But is standing in line for an expensive cheese pie ‚Äì or tomato slice ‚Äì really worth it? Since NYC is home to some of the best pizza in the country, some might be skeptical of a rookie pizza shop, whose original concept came about during the pandemic.

After spending four years trying to secure a lease and refusing to take on investors, Geldmacher and Serebnick racked up credit card debt to get the place up and running.

And now? The gamble seems to be paying off. Fast.

And while some doubters exist ‚Äî like Cuozzo, who declared some slices ‚Äútoo dry for my taste‚Äù ‚Äî others who managed to snag a desired slice agreed with Portnoy‚Äôs extremely high rating.¬†

‚ÄúIt lived up to the hype. The regular slice is amazing, the sauce is great, the cheese is great and fresh. ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs definitely within the top three pizzas I‚Äôve ever tried for sure,‚Äù Chera told The Post.

‚ÄúI had six slices ‚Äì it is probably the best pizza in Manhattan, maybe the best pizza in the five boroughs,‚Äù Ades added.¬†Those sound like fighting words.

The drool-worthy pizza at Ceres not only delighted customers‚Äô taste buds ‚Äî it brought them together.

Standing on the busy Mott Street sidewalk outside the pizzeria, kind customers like Shemia and Justin Chapman offered a slice of their $40 pie to those who got turned away.

‚ÄúEnjoy,‚Äù Chapman said, as a beaming Albert held up a slice she never thought she would get a chance to try before heading back home to Seattle. After taking a bite, she told The Post, ‚ÄúI love thin crust pizza ‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs actually pretty perfect.‚Äù

‚ÄúI wasn‚Äôt going to let a $40 pie go to waste,‚Äù Chapman said about sharing his pizza with a stranger. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what we do in New York.‚Äù

Ceres will be closed from May 16 to May 20, so anyone who wants to try the highly-rated pizza can come on May 21.¬†
item.author: Marissa Matozzo

item.title: ÂÖãÈáåÊñØ¬∑Â∏ÉÊúóÔºà Chris Brown ÔºâÁöÑÊúÄÊñ∞Âêç‰∫∫Â∞ÜÂú®ÈáçÁ£ÖÁÇ∏ÂºπSean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù CombsÂÆ°Âà§‰∏≠ËÑ±È¢ñËÄåÂá∫‚Äî‰ª•ÂèäÁ•ûÁßòÁöÑNFLÁêÉÂëòCassie Ventura | Chris Brown latest celebrity to get name-dropped at bombshell Sean ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äô Combs trial ‚Äî along with mystery NFL player Cassie Ventura dated
item.description:
Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs‚Äô lawyer asked Cassie Ventura about a time when Combs was mad at her because he thought she‚Äôd been dancing with singer Chris Brown.

‚ÄúDo you remember when [Combs] thought you were dancing with Chris Brown?‚Äù Combs‚Äô lawyer Anna Estevao asked Ventura.

‚ÄúI do but I was not ‚Ä¶ I wasn‚Äôt dancing with Chris Brown,‚Äù she responded.

Estevao moved on to another topic after the brief exchange.

Brown is just one among a list of celebrities whose names have come up at trial. Britney Spears came up Thursday because Combs invited the pop star to Ventura‚Äôs 21st birthday bash at a Vegas club.

Actor Michael B. Jordan and rapper Kid Cudi also both came up because they‚Äôd been romantically involved with Ventura.

The court also heard Friday how Combs once snatched Ventura‚Äôs phone out her hand while they were in a car together ‚Äî because he suspected that she was dating a professional football player.

Ventura testified about the August 2016 incident, where Combs ran down Wilshire Boulevard in Los Angeles with her phone. She said that her mom eventually called the police after she returned home without the phone.

Esevao painted the incident as another instance of Combs‚Äô jealously.

The athlete‚Äôs identity wasn‚Äôt revealed, but Ventura confirmed that he was a professional NFL player at the time.

‚ÄúHe was upset with you when he suspected you of cheating, right?‚Äù Esevao asked.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know I would call it cheating at that point,‚Äù Ventura replied.
item.author: Kyle Schnitzer, Priscilla DeGregory

item.title: Á∫ΩÁ∫¶Â∏ÇÂ∏ÇÈïøÂÄôÈÄâ‰∫∫Zohran MamdaniÊãíÁªùÁ≠æÁΩ≤Ë∞¥Ë¥£Â§ßÂ±†ÊùÄÁöÑÂÜ≥ËÆÆÔºåÊîØÊåÅ‰ª•Ëâ≤Âàó | NYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani refuses to sign resolutions condemning Holocaust, supporting Israel
item.description:
Socialist mayoral hopeful Zohran Mamdani refused to sign onto a pair of resolutions recognizing Israel and the holocaust ‚Äî as the state lawmaker vies to lead a city with the largest concentration of Jewish people outside Israel.

Mamdani skipped out on one resolution earlier this week that celebrated the Jewish state on its 77th anniversary. Last year, he declined to sign onto another resolution that denounced the holocaust.

Thousands of resolutions are introduced each year and are almost always non-controversial signs of respect to groups or countries.

Last month, the assembly honored Fort Drum with a measure when members of the U.S. Army military reserves visited the state‚Äôs capital.

Mamdani has signed onto 88 similar pieces of non-binding legislation over his tenure.

Courting the Jewish vote is proving to be a key issue in the Democratic primary and general election as frontrunner Andrew Cuomo and incumbent Eric Adams both try to win the support of the bloc.

News of the DSA assemblyman blowing off the measures ‚Äî which was first reported by Politico ‚Äî comes just a day after getting the endorsement of Jamaal Bowman, a former US representative who lost his seat over his pro-Palestine views.
item.author: Vaughn Golden, Craig McCarthy

item.title: Ëê®Â∞îÊõº¬∑Êãâ‰ªÄËø™Ôºà Salman Rushdie ÔºâÁöÑË¢≠ÂáªËÄÖÂìàËø™¬∑È©¨Â°îÂ∞îÔºà Hadi Matar ÔºâÂõ†ÂèØÊÄïÁöÑÂà∫‰º§ËÄå | Salman Rushdie‚Äôs attacker Hadi Matar gets max sentence for horrific stabbing
item.description:
The crazed fanatic who tried to stab Salman Rushdie to death on a New York lecture stage was sentenced Friday to the maximum term of 25 years in prison.

Hadi Matar, 26, was found guilty of attempted murder and assault in February over the horrific attack that saw him try to carry out a decades-old fatwa by ambushing the 77-year-old novelist as he was giving a lecture at the Chautauqua Institute in August 2022.

Before sentencing, the knifeman ‚Äî who repeatedly shouted pro-Palestinian slogans during his trial ‚Äî stood and made a statement about freedom of speech in which he called Rushdie a hypocrite.

Matar received the maximum 25-year sentence for the attempted murder of Rushdie and seven years for wounding a man who was on stage with him. The sentences must run concurrently because both victims were injured in the same event, District Attorney Jason Schmidt said.

The sentence was handed down after a seven-day trial in which Rushdie took the stand to recount the vicious attack ‚Äî even showing jurors his sightless right eye, which he keeps hidden behind a darkened lens in his eyeglasses.

Rushdie described, too, in harrowing detail how he feared he was dying when his masked attacker plunged the knife into his head and body more than a dozen times just as he was being introduced on stage to give the lecture on writer safety.

Footage of the bloodshed played during the trial showed a knife-wielding Matar approaching from behind before stabbing him in front of the horrified audience.

Rushdie could be seen stumbling forward as Matar clung to him, swinging and stabbing until they both fell to the floor and were separated by witnesses.

In addition to being blinded in one eye, the author suffered nerve and liver damage ‚Äî all of which he barely survived.

Rushdie ‚Äî who detailed his recovery in¬†his 2024 memoir ‚ÄúKnife‚Äù ‚Äî spent 17 days at a Pennsylvania hospital in the aftermath of the attack, as well as more than three weeks at a New York City rehabilitation center.

Matar ‚Äî who was born in America but also has Lebanese citizenship ‚Äî still faces a federal trial on¬†terrorism-related charges.¬†

Authorities alleged that Matar was trying to carry out a decades-old fatwa, or edict, calling for Rushdie‚Äôs death when he traveled from his home in Fairview, New Jersey, to target the writer.

Matar believed the fatwa, first issued in 1989, was backed by the Lebanon-based militant group Hezbollah and endorsed in a 2006 speech by the group‚Äôs secretary-general, Hassan Nasrallah, federal prosecutors charged.

He has pleaded not guilty to providing material to terrorists, attempting to provide material support to Hezbollah and engaging in terrorism transcending national boundaries.

With Post wires
item.author: Emily Crane

item.title: ÂáØË•ø¬∑ÊñáÂõæÊãâÔºà Cassie Ventura ÔºâÈÄèÈú≤‰∫Ü‚ÄúÂ•áÊÄ™‚ÄùÁöÑÁü≠‰ø°ËÇñÊÅ©¬∑ ‚ÄúËø™Ëø™‚Äù ¬∑Â∫ìÂßÜÊñØÔºà Sean ‚ÄôDiddy‚Äò Combs ÔºâÂú®2016Âπ¥ÈÖíÂ∫óÈÅ≠Âà∞ÊÆãÈÖ∑ÊÆ¥ÊâìÂêéÂèëÈÄÅÁªôÂ•πÁöÑÁü≠‰ø°ÔºåÂΩìÊó∂Â•π | Cassie Ventura reveals ‚Äòstrange‚Äô text Sean ‚ÄòDiddy‚Äô Combs sent her after brutal 2016 hotel beating when she told him ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not a rag doll‚Äô
item.description:
Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs slid a disconcerting text to his ex-girlfriend Cassie Ventura just days after he infamously attacked her in a Los Angeles hotel ‚Äî and she accused him of treating her like a ‚Äúrag doll,‚Äù a Manhattan court heard Friday.

The pair‚Äôs text exchange after the 2016 caught-on-video beating was revealed just minutes into Ventura‚Äôs fourth day on the stand in Combs‚Äô federal sex trafficking trial, as his attorneys continued to grill her about her tumultuous decade-long relationship with the Bad Boy Records founder.

Jurors heard Ventura‚Äôs text from March 10, 2016 read aloud in the courtroom, in which she accused Combs of abuse during the altercation at the InterContinental Hotel in Century City.

‚ÄúWhen you get f‚Äìked up the wrong way you always want to show me that you have the power and you knock me around,‚Äù she wrote.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm not a rag doll, I‚Äôm someone‚Äôs child.‚Äù

But Combs didn‚Äôt appear to treat the incident with its proper gravity ‚Äî within days he texted Ventura that he was ‚Äúhorny‚Äù for her, jurors learned.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm so horny for you!!!‚Äù Combs texted Ventura on March 9, 2016.

Ventura gave a cold response: ‚ÄúYou are? Why? What made you feel that way?‚Äù

From the witness stand, the eight months pregnant Ventura said she felt the text was a ‚Äúlittle strange‚Äù to receive just days after the attack.

Ventura, an R&B singer and mom of two, spent much of her time testifying about old messages and recordings from her turbulent relationship with the mogul.

She has testified that Combs made her participate in degrading sex parties called ‚Äúfreak-offs‚Äù that prosecutors allege were part of a wider pattern of sex trafficking and racketeering.

One clip of a 2014 audio recording played Friday featured Ventura screaming and threatening to kill a man who claimed he‚Äôd seen a sexually explicit video of her.

Ventura could be heard attempting to get more information out of the man about the alleged video he‚Äôd viewed but when he wouldn‚Äôt divulge helpful details she went off the rails.

‚ÄúI will kill you if you don‚Äôt show me right now,‚Äù Ventura could be heard yelling in the recording. ‚ÄúI will cut you up and put you in the f‚Äîing dirt right now.‚Äù

‚ÄúPut that s‚Äìt up right now,‚Äù the recording continued. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm tired of you talking s‚Äìt right now. It‚Äôs not going to be blood on my hands, someone else is going to do it.‚Äù

As Ventura, 38, listened from the witness stand, she leaned back in her chair very nonchalantly.

Jurors also learned that Ventura messaged Combs about what the man told her and the music producer told her not to let him ‚Äúout of your sight.‚Äù

Revealing the exchange appeared to be an attempt by the defense to show Combs didn‚Äôt want the ‚Äúfreak-off‚Äù video to get out either, which Ventura acknowledged in her testimony.

She previously testified that she Combs threatened to release the videos on multiple occasions.

Combs has pleaded not guilty to one count of racketeering conspiracy, two counts of sex trafficking by force, fraud or coercion, and two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution.

He could face life in prison, if convicted.
item.author: Kyle Schnitzer, Jack Morphet, Priscilla DeGregory, Matt Troutman

item.title: Êñ∞Ê≥ΩË•øÂ∑ûÂ∑ûÈïøÂ¢®Ëè≤Âú®ÈÄöÂã§Âô©Ê¢¶‰∏≠ÁΩ¢Â∑•Êñ∞Ê≥ΩË•øÂ∑ûÂÖ¨ÂÖ±‰∫§ÈÄöÂ∑•‰ºöÂ∑•‰∫∫Ôºö ‚Äú‰ªñ‰ª¨Ëá™Â∑±Âà∂ÈÄ†ÁöÑÊ∑∑‰π±‚Äù | NJ Gov. Murphy blasts striking NJ Transit union workers amid commuter nightmare: ‚ÄòMess of their own making‚Äô
item.description:
New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy ripped NJ Transit engineers for going on strike Friday ‚Äî blasting their actions as a ‚Äúslap in the face‚Äù to commuters and a ‚Äúmess of their own making.‚Äù

The Democrat lashed out after¬†roughly 400 rail engineers walked off the job¬†after marathon contract talks stalled ahead of a midnight deadline, setting off the first strike to hit the major transit system in more than 40 years.

‚ÄúIt did not have to come to this,‚Äù Murphy told a news conference after the morning commuter rush got underway.

‚ÄúA small handful of locomotive engineers have walked off the job and shut down our entire transit system,‚Äù he continued, adding that ‚Äúwe‚Äôre talking just under 400 engineers in a total workforce of about 12,000.‚Äù

‚ÄúIt is, frankly, a mess of their own making ‚Äî and it is a slap in the face of every commuter and worker who relies on NJ Transit.‚Äù

Murphy urged the Brotherhood of Locomotive Engineers and Trainmen union (BLET), which represents the engineers who drive the agency‚Äôs commuter trains, to come back to the negotiating table.

‚ÄúWhat the people of New Jersey need right now is for the members to meet their obligations to the public,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs end the strike.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe are ready to restart negotiations, literally this second, but we need the BLET to come back to the negotiating table in good faith,‚Äù he added.

The union, for their part, blamed transit management negotiators for walking out of the bargaining talks late Thursday.

‚ÄúWe presented them with a deal and they walked away,‚Äù the union‚Äôs national president, Mark Wallace, said. ‚ÄúThey chose to leave. We did not.‚Äù

Wages¬†are the key sticking point of the strike, according to the union.

BLET had been seeking its first pay increase since 2019 for 450 of its engineers, a source familiar with the negotiations earlier told The Post, adding that NJ Transit could fully fund the sought increase with a seven-and-a-half-year contract for less than $30 million.

The union has said it was aiming to raise the engineers‚Äô salaries to match those at other commuter railroads in the region.

NJ Transit, however, has said it can‚Äôt afford the pay raises the engineers are seeking because 14 other unions that negotiate separate labor contracts with the agency would¬†then demand¬†higher wage rates for their members.

‚ÄúI for one refuse to pass the buck or increase taxes on hard working New Jerseyans for the same, or even more likely, reduced service. That‚Äôs not going to happen. That is untenable,‚Äù Murphy said.

He argued, too, that it wasn‚Äôt about politics.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre holding the line for the next governor and the next administration so they do not inherit a NJ Transit that is on the brink of fiscal collapse, but is in fact in a strong state of health,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThat is what it means to fix NJ Transit, leaving the agency better in every respect, but especially in fiscal terms, than when we entered office.‚Äù
item.author: Emily Crane
